III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
1

(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a
youth's background or appearance or mental state. Yelling,
threats, ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 is rude and disrespectful and abusive. Staff have taken her
belongings. The belongs were not specified.
Investigation Interviews:
All interviews were completed on 12/10/25 face to face at the
facility unless otherwise specified.
Administrator 1:
Administrator 1 did not provide any new details. She provided
incident reports to review.
Youth A:
Youth A reported she was going offsite to visit her mother. Youth
A reported she did not want to go. Youth A reported Staff 1 was
transporting her to the visit. Youth A reported she was blasting her
music with her headphones and was laying down in the back seat
of the van. Youth A reported she did not have her seat belt on.
Youth A reported Staff 1 yelled at her to put her seatbelt on. Youth
A reported after she put her seatbelt on, she went back to listening
to her music and did not speak to Staff 1 again. Youth A reported
that she has never been abused by staff. Youth A reported staff
have not taken any of her belongings.
Complainant 1:
I spoke to Complainant 1 on 12/6/25. Complainant 1 did not have
any additional information to provide.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 reported she was transporting Youth A to her family visit off
campus on 12/4/24. Staff 1 reported Youth A sat in the third row of
the van and put her earbuds in. Youth A then moved to the
second row and did not put her seatbelt on. Staff 1 reported she
asked Youth A three times to put her seatbelt on and Youth A did
not hear her or listen to her. Staff 1 reported she raised her voice
so that Youth A would hear her over the ear pods. Youth A at first
refused to put her seatbelt on, but then changed her mind. Staff 1
reported Youth A was upset the entire time they were together
because she did not want to visit her family. Staff 1 reported while
Youth A was in her visit, she received a phone call from
Supervisor 1. Supervisor 1 asked her if she had been using
2

profanities and vulgar language with Youth A. Staff 1 reported
Youth A contacted her supervisor while in the building and refused
to be transported back to the facility. The agency contacted the
worker and had the worker return her to the site. Staff 1 reported
she has not taken any belongings of Youth A or other youth. Staff
1 reported there is a process to remove belongings. Staff 1
reported she has never abused any youth, including Youth A.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported she received a phone call from Youth A
while on her family visit on 12/4/24. Youth A refused to get in the
vehicle with Staff 1. Supervisor 1 reported she called Staff 1 and
asked her what happened. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 stated
Youth A had her ear pods in and she had to raise her voice so that
Youth A would put her seatbelt on. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1
stated that was the only conversation between them in the vehicle.
Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 did not transport Youth A back but
the worker that was present for the visit did. Supervisor 1 reported
when Youth A returned, she grabbed her backpack and attempted
to AWOL. Supervisor 1 reported they took her backpack to stop
her from AWOLing. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 2 was present and
did a good job deescalating the situation. Supervisor 1 reported
that is the only belongings they have taken from Youth A.
Supervisor 1 reported she has never witnessed any staff abuse
any youth in the facility, including Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported
when Youth A had deescalated, she admitted she was lying about
Staff 1 using profanity and vulgar language towards her in the van.
Staff 2:
Staff 2 reported she has never seen staff abuse Youth A. Staff 2
reported she was present when Youth A came back from her
family visit and attempted to AWOL on 12/4/24. Staff 2 reported
Youth A grabbed her backpack, and they took it from her. Staff 2
reported she has a good relationship with Youth A and was able to
deescalate her.
Youth B:
Youth B reported she has never seen Staff 1 abuse Youth A.
Youth B reported she has never had her belongings taken from
staff. Youth B reported staff will take contraband (i.e. vapes) if
they find them.
Documents:
• I reviewed the incident report dated 12/4/24, written by Staff
1, pertaining to the offsite transportation. The incident
report agrees with Staff 1’s interview.
3

• I reviewed the incident report written by Staff 2 on 12/4/24,
pertaining to Youth A’s AWOL attempt. The incident report
agrees with Supervisor 1 and Staff 2’s interview.
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All clearances and
trainings were up to date. There was no discipline action in
Staff 1’s file.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance as both Youth A and Staff 1
deny Staff 1 was rude, disrespectful or abusive.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
